Articles.Content:
First post here, Hello.

I decided to create an ugly plane, so the first plane that came to mind was Boeing's X-32 for the JSF competition.

Boeing's site: http://www.boeing.com/boeing/history/boeing/jsf.page

This monster can actually fly, although VTOL capabilities stretched the vehicle too far. The real X-32 could travel at super cruise without its VTOL systems, my version just pushes Mach 1.1 at 11 kilometers.

It did require Ferram Aerospace Research to prevent the angled tail rudders from causing problems. Other than FAR no other mods were used.

Yes, Part clipping was used.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

The intake is a cluster of ram intakes and landing gear is ugly too.

All in all, the ugly Kerbal Space Program version is just as ugly and just scrapes by the requirements like the Boeing concept.

In harsh honesty, I am really glad the X-35 is representing the United States and the United Kingdom.

Any pointers or criticisms on visual accuracy or building techniques are completely welcome.
